As concerns the San Bernardino area, it can be seen that television has long
since outstripped radio in becoming a major source of at-home evening entertainment.
(The Community Education Project at San Bernardino Valley College is now planning
to develop a TV series, using the techniques of the "Ways of Mankind" experiment.)
Of course the method of survey, the sample selected, and the very mde of
questioning can all be challenged. However it would seem that the formula applied
(the selection of each 100th residential telephone listed) and th. number of calls
made, would compare more than favorably with the performance of commercial radio
listening survey teams that from time to time have been employed to investigate
listenership in San Bernardino.
Projecting the one percent sample to the total population of San Bernardino,
a listening audience of roughly 2,500 is obtained. Since the population in the
area covered by the experiment is approximately four times this, a very rough pro¬
jection of the San Bernardino sample yields an estimated listening audience of
10,000 people who enjoyed the "Ways of Mankind" program. It might be pointed out , i
that the sample, if it errs, is on the conservative side. It obviously does not
include the people who were avra.y from their homes because they were participating
in discussion groups. Nor does it include people who may have listened to a re¬
broadcast of the program on Sunday afternoons. (The rebroadcasting was arranged
for people who could not get the program in the evening but could during the day
because of differences in the transmitting angle of the station.) A third factor
was the mail response to the program. Mail response was considerably higher from
communities where TV reception is non-existent than in San Bernardino where TV
reception is good in most parts of the city. The radio audience was unquestionably
greater in the non-TV areas, but it was impossible to check this.

Weekly Report Sheets. These were submitted by most of the groups registered. The
sheets furnished data on the quality of the discussion, the topics discussed.
